page.title: 15Quinton Green Farm Grassland
page.content: Quinton Green Farm covers 800 acres, bordering the M1 motorway, Quinton Village, Preston Deanery, and Salcey Forest. One third of the farm is used as grassland, which provides two cuts of silage per year and summer grazing for 350 head of Pedigree Friesians cows. 90% of the cows calve between August and November. The cows are artificially inseminated by the cowmen with top Pedigree Friesian/Holsten semen; embryo from the best cows, in the not too distant future, will be implanted in good breeding cows.In winter the cows occupy a 180' x 114' clear span building. Each cow has it's own sleeping cubicle from which the dung is automatically scraped into an underground pit. From here it passes into a 20'high, 60'diameter slurry tower.
